page.title: 15LOCAL HISTORY,THE STAR INN
page.content: THE STAR INN AT NORMANS BAY DATES BACK TO 1402,WHEN IT WAS BUILT AS A SLUICE-KEEPERS COTTAGE BUT IT WAS NOT USED AS AN INN UNTIL 1550.IT WAS OFTEN USED BY SMUGGLERS.IT WAS THE HEAD- QUARTERS OF MANY SMUGGLER GANGS AND MANY FIGHTS TOOK PLACE BETWEEN THEM AND THE CUSTOMS MEN.IT IS SUPPOSED TO HAVE BEEN THE LAST SMUGGLER-STRONGHOLD IN SUSSEX. IT'S OWNER,MR MAYNARD,LIVES IN THE FLAT ABOVE THE PUB,WHICH IS NON RESIDENTIAL BUT THERE IS A CARAVAN SITE NEXT DOOR.THE TRADE IS VERY SEASONAL.NORMANS BAY IS A VERY QUIET, PEACEFUL VILLAGE,BUT HE DOES NOT FEEL THERE IS MUCH OF A COMMUNITY SPIRIT THERE.THE BAY IS QUITE INTERESTING,ITS HISTORY GOING BACK TO 1066 WHEN WILLIAM THE CONQUEROR LANDED THERE WITH HIS ARMY.THE ROAD TO THE BAY, WHICH RUNS PAST THE PUB IS VERY NARROW WITH SUMMER TRAFFIC JAMS.
